definition: lit. ninety li is merely a half of a hundred li journey (idiom)/fig. the closer one is to completing a task, the tougher it gets/a task is not done until it's done
pinyin: xing2 bai3 li3 zhe3 ban4 jiu3 shi2

definition: row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
hundred/numerous/all kinds of
surname Bai
Li (surname)

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
nine/9
ten/10

sentences.english: Ninety miles is only half of a hundred miles journey.
sentences.chinese: 行百里者半九十的英語說法是什麼？

sentences.english: TRADE deals are often concluded at the eleventh hour.
sentences.chinese: 貿易協定談判通常行百里者半九十。

definition: lit. a thousand mile journey begins with the first step/fig. big accomplishments come from an accumulation of little achievements made one by one
pinyin: qian1 li3 zhi1 xing2 , shi3 yu2 zu2 xia4

definition: a really determined person will find a solution (idiom); where there's a will, there's a way
pinyin: you3 zhi4 zhe3 shi4 jing4 cheng2

definition: almost everything has a start, but not many things have an end (idiom); don't start sth you can't handle
pinyin: mi3 bu4 you3 chu1 , xian3 ke4 you3 zhong1

definition: easy to grasp but difficult to put into practice (idiom)/easier said than done
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/don't try to run before you can walk
there is nothing the determined person can't accomplish (idiom)/persistence will overcome
pinyin: shi4 shang4 wu2 nan2 shi4 , zhi3 pa4 you3 xin1 ren2
related.word: 世上無難事，只怕有心人

definition: lit. sharpening the axe won't make the wood-splitting take longer (idiom)/fig. time invested in preparations is not lost/a beard well lathered is half shaved
pinyin: mo2 dao1 bu4 wu4 kan3 chai2 gong1

definition: lit. once you've shot the arrow, there's no getting it back (idiom)/fig. once you started sth, there's no turning back/to have to finish what one started/to be determined to reach one's goals in spite of setbacks
pinyin: kai1 gong1 mei2 you3 hui2 tou2 jian4

definition: effort will undoubtedly lead to success (idiom)
every beginning is difficult (idiom)/getting started is always the hardest part
you get what you put in/you reap what you sow
pinyin: yi1 fen1 geng1 yun2 , yi1 fen1 shou1 huo4

definition: lit. navigating a boat against the current (idiom)/fig. in a tough environment (one needs to work hard)
lit. nothing is difficult on this earth, if your mind is set (idiom)
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu2 nan2 shi4 , zhi3 pa4 you3 xin1 ren2
related.word: 天下無難事，只怕有心人

definition: If you work at it hard enough, you can grind an iron bar into a needle./cf idiom 磨杵成針|磨杵成针, to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently
pinyin: zhi3 yao4 gong1 fu5 shen1 , tie3 chu3 mo2 cheng2 zhen1
related.word: 只要功夫深，鐵杵磨成針

definition: Heaven rewards the diligent. (idiom)
to guard against pride and impatience (idiom); to remain modest and keep cool
